alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Clark; Dallas; Grant; Hot Spring; Jefferson; Monroe; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 4:15AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as zero to 5 below zero this morning and again tonight and Tuesday morning. For the Winter Storm Warning, additional snow and sleet accumulations up to an inch are expected this morning. * WHERE...Much of central into southern Arkansas. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until noon CST today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With Arctic air firmly in place, impacts from snowfall will last for several days, resulting in a prolonged period of hazardous travel conditions. Bitter cold wind chills could result in frostbite as well as significant impacts to infrastructure.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Be sure to check road conditions before traveling in these areas. Visit the Arkansas Department of Transportation`s website Idrivearkansas.com for the latest road and traffic conditions.
